metadata.title: CVE-2018-10907 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: It was found that glusterfs server is vulnerable to multiple stack basedbuffer overflows due to functions in server-rpc-fopc.c allocating fixedsize buffers using 'alloca(3)'. An authenticated attacker could exploitthis by mounting a gluster volume and sending a string longer that thefixed buffer size to cause crash or potential code execution.

criterions.comment: glusterfs: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
